2.name: Cross
2.description: A ball played in from wide areas into the box

3.name: Head pass
3.description: Pass made with a players head

4.name: Through ball
4.description: Ball played through for player making an attacking run to create a chance on goal

5.name: Free kick taken
5.description: Any free kick; direct or indirect

6.name: Corner taken
6.description: All corners. Look for qualifier 6 but excluding qualifier 2 for short corners

7.name: Players caught offside
7.description: Player who was in an offside position when pass was made.

8.name: Goal disallowed
8.description: Pass led to a goal disallowed for a foul or offside

106.name: Attacking Pass
106.description: A pass in the opposition’s half of the pitch

140.name: Pass End X
140.description: The x pitch coordinate for the end point of a pass - See Appendix 11

141.name: Pass End Y
141.description: The y pitch coordinate for the end point of a pass - See Appendix 11

155.name: Chipped
155.description: Pass which was chipped into the air

156.name: Lay-off
156.description: Pass where player laid the ball into the path of a teammates run

157.name: Launch
157.description: Pass played from a player’s own half up towards front players. Aimed to hit a zone rather than a specific player

168.name: Flick-on
168.description: Pass where a player has 'flicked' the ball forward using their head

195.name: Pull Back
195.description: Player in opposition’s penalty box reaches the by-line and passes (cuts) the ball backwards to a teammate

196.name: Switch of play
196.description: Any pass which crosses the centre zone of the pitch and in length is greater than 60 on the y axis of the pitch

210.name: Assist
210.description: The pass was an assist for a shot. The type of shot then dictates whether it was a goal assist or just key pass.

212.name: Length
212.description: The estimated length the ball has travelled during the associated event.

213.name: Angle
213.description: The angle the ball travels at during an event relative to the direction of play. Shown in radians.

218.name: 2nd assist
218.description: Pass was deemed a 2nd assist - created the opportunity for another player to assist a goal

219.name: Players on both posts
219.description: Assigned to event 6 indicating there were defensive players on both posts when a corner was taken

220.name: Player on near post
220.description: Assigned to event 6 indicating there was a defensive player on only the near post when a corner was taken

221.name: Player on far post
221.description: Assigned to event 6 indicating there was a defensive player on only the far post when corner was taken

222.name: No players on posts
222.description: Assigned to event 6 indicating there were no defensive players on either post when a corner was taken

223.name: In-swinger
223.description: Corner was crossed into the box swerving towards the goal

224.name: Out-swinger
224.description: Corner was crossed into the  box swerving away from the goal

225.name: Straight
225.description: Corner was crossed into the box with a straight ball flight

236.name: Blocked Pass
236.description: Similar to interception but player already very close to ball - instead of touch event in past. Or assigned to the pass to indicate it was blocked

238.name: Fair Play
238.description: Ball kicked out of play for injury etc

240.name: GK Start
240.description: Automated qualifier which appears on all GK passes after keeper collects ball with his hands and then puts it on the ground.

241.name: Indirect
241.description: Shows if indirect freekick is taken

266.name: Put Through
266.description: Gets assigned to the defending player who should have denied the pass. A “put through “ is always linked with a “failed to block” event on the defending teams side.

278.name: Tap
278.description: Freekick rolled - to enable exclusion from passing %

279.name: Kick Off
279.description: Starting pass - to enable exclusion from passing %

15.name: Head
15.description: Any event where the player used their head such as a shot or a clearance

72.name: Left footed
72.description: Player shot with their left foot

21.name: Other body part
21.description: Shot was neither via a player’s head or foot for example knee or chest

22.name: Regular play
22.description: Shot during open play as opposed to from a set play

23.name: Fast break
23.description: Shot occurred following a fast break situation

24.name: Set piece
24.description: Shot occurred from a crossed free kick

26.name: Free kick
26.description: Shot occurred directly from a free kick

96.name: Corner situation
96.description: Pass or shot event in corner situation. 25 is used when the goal is direct from corner, 96 relates to 2nd phase attack.

97.name: Direct free
97.description: 26 will be used for shot directly from a free kick. 97 only used with Opta GoalData (game system 4) but not with full data.

112.name: Scramble
112.description: Goal where there was a scramble for possession of the ball and the defence had an opportunity to clear

160.name: Throw-in set piece
160.description: Shot came from a throw-in set piece

29.name: Assisted
29.description: Indicates that there was a pass (assist) from another player to set up the goal opportunity

154.name: Intentional assist
154.description: Shot from an intentional assist i.e. The assisting player intended the pass, no deflection etc

55.name: Related event ID
55.description: This will appear for goals or shots, the related event_id will be that of the assist and thus show the assisting player ID

216.name: 2nd related event ID
216.description: If there was a 2nd assist, i.e a pass to create the opportunity for the player making the assist. MLS and German Bundesliga 1 & 2.

233.name: Opposite related event ID
233.description: Used for any event where there is the same event for both teams with outcome 1 or 0. This relates the 2 event together, for example aerial duels

9.name: Penalty
9.description: When attempt on goal was a penalty kick. ALSO used on Event type 4 to indicate a penalty was awarded

28.name: Own goal
28.description: Own goal . Note: Use the inverse coordinates of the goal location

108.name: Volley
108.description: Shot on the volley (ball doesn't bounce before the shot)

110.name: Half Volley
110.description: Shot on the half volley (hit immediately after the ball bounces) – NO LONGER USED

111.name: Diving Header
111.description: Shot where the player dives to head the ball – NO LONGER USED

113.name: Strong
113.description: Shot was subjectively classed as strong

114.name: Weak
114.description: Shot was subjectively classed as weak

115.name: Rising
115.description: Shot was rising in the air

116.name: Dipping
116.description: Shot was dipping towards the ground

117.name: Lob
117.description: Shot was an attempt by the attacker to play the ball over the goalkeeper and into the goal

118.name: One Bounce
118.description: Shot where the ball bounced once on its way towards the goal – NO LONGER USED

119.name: Few Bounces
119.description: Shot where the ball bounced several times on its way to the goal – NO LONGER USED

120.name: Swerve Left
120.description: Shot which swerves to the left - from attackers perspective

121.name: Swerve Right
121.description: Shot which swerves to the right - from attackers perspective

122.name: Swerve Moving
122.description: Shot which swerves in several directions

136.name: Keeper Touched
136.description: Goal where the goalkeeper got a touch on the ball as it went in

137.name: Keeper Saved
137.description: Shot going wide or over the goal but still collected/saved by the goalkeeper with event type 15

138.name: Hit Woodwork
138.description: Any shot which hits the post or crossbar

153.name: Not past goal line
153.description: Shot missed which does not  pass the goal line

214.name: Big Chance
214.description: Shot was deemed by Opta analysts an excellent opportunity to score – clear cut chance eg one on one

215.name: Individual Play
215.description: Player created the chance to shoot by himself, not assisted. For example he dribbled to create space for himself and shot.

217.name: 2nd assisted
217.description: Indicates that this shot had a significant pass to create the opportunity for the pass which led to a goal

228.name: Own shot blocked
228.description: Player blocks an attacking shot  unintentionally from their teammate

230.name: GK X Coordinate
230.description: GK position when goal or shot hit post

231.name: GK Y Coordinate
231.description: GK position when goal or shot hit post

249.name: Temp_ShotOn
249.description: Shot has occurred but it is pending additional detail qualifiers from Opta.

250.name: Temp_Blocked
250.description: Block has occurred but it is pending additional detail qualifiers from Opta.

251.name: Temp_Post
251.description: Shot has hit the post but it is pending additional detail qualifiers from Opta.

252.name: Temp_Missed
252.description: Shot has missed but it is pending additional detail qualifiers from Opta.

253.name: Temp_MissNotPassedGoalLine
253.description: Shot has missed but not gone past the end line but it is pending additional detail qualifiers from Opta.

254.name: Follows a Dribble
254.description: A goal followed a dribble by the goalscorer

261.name: 1 on 1 Chip
261.description: Goal scored via a 1 on 1 chip over the goalkeeper

262.name: Back Heel
262.description: Goal scored via a back heel

263.name: Direct Corner
263.description: Shot or goal directly from a corner

280.name: Fantasy Assist Type
280.description: Related Event to - PASS_LOST, BLOCKED_SHOT, ATTEMPT_SAVED, POST, FREE_KICK_WON, HANDBALL_WON, OWN_GOAL, PENALTY_WON

284.name: Duel
284.description: Indicates Blocked Shot is a duel

16.name: Small box-centre
16.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

17.name: Box-centre
17.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

18.name: Out of box-centre
18.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

19.name: 35+ centre
19.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

60.name: Small box-right
60.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

61.name: Small box-left
61.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

62.name: Box-deep right
62.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

63.name: Box-right
63.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

64.name: Box-left
64.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

65.name: Box-deep left
65.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

66.name: Out of box-deep right
66.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

67.name: Out of box-right
67.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

68.name: Out of box-left
68.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

69.name: Out of box-deep left
69.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

70.name: 35+ right
70.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

71.name: 35+ left
71.description: Zone of the pitch - See appendix 13

73.name: Left
73.description: Hit the left post or missed left

75.name: Right
75.description: Hit right post or missed right

76.name: Low left
76.description: Zone of the goalmouth - See appendix 12

77.name: High left
77.description: Zone of the goalmouth - See appendix 12

78.name: Low centre
78.description: Zone of the goalmouth - See appendix 12

79.name: High centre
79.description: Zone of the goalmouth - See appendix 12

80.name: Low right
80.description: Zone of the goalmouth - See appendix 12

81.name: High right
81.description: Zone of the goalmouth - See appendix 12

82.name: Blocked
82.description: Zone of the goalmouth - See appendix 12

83.name: Close left
83.description: Zone of the goalmouth - See appendix 12

84.name: Close right
84.description: Zone of the goalmouth - See appendix 12

85.name: Close high
85.description: Zone of the goalmouth - See appendix 12

86.name: Close left and high
86.description: Zone of the goalmouth - See appendix 12

87.name: Close right and high
87.description: Zone of the goalmouth - See appendix 12

100.name: Six yard blocked
100.description: Shot blocked on the 6 yard line

101.name: Saved off line
101.description: Shot saved on the goal line

102.name: Goal mouth y co-ordinate
102.description: Y Co-ordinate of where a shot crossed goal line - see Appendix 12

103.name: Goal mouth z co-ordinate
103.description: Z Co-ordinate for height at which a shot crossed the goal line - see Appendix 12

134.name: Far Wide Left
134.description: NO LONGER USED - Shot from wide left

135.name: Far Wide Right
135.description: NO LONGER USED - Shot from wide right

146.name: Blocked x co-ordinate
146.description: The x pitch coordinate for where a shot was blocked

147.name: Blocked y co-ordinate
147.description: The y pitch coordinate for where a shot was blocked

276.name: Out on sideline
276.description: Shot missed and went out on sideline

11.name: 6-seconds violation
11.description: Goalkeeper held onto the ball longer than 6 seconds resulting in a free kick

12.name: Dangerous play
12.description: A foul due to dangerous play

32.name: Second yellow
32.description: Player receives a 2nd yellow card which automatically results in a red card

33.name: Red card
33.description: Player shown a straight red card

34.name: Referee abuse
34.description: Card shown to player because of abuse to the referee

35.name: Argument
35.description: Card shown to player because of an argument

36.name: Fight
36.description: Card shown to player because of their involvement in a fight

37.name: Time wasting
37.description: Card shown to player for time wasting

38.name: Excessive celebration
38.description: Card shown to player for excessively celebrating a goal

39.name: Crowd interaction
39.description: Card shown to player because of contact or communication with the crowd

95.name: Back pass
95.description: Free kick given for an illegal pass to the goalkeeper which was collected by his hands or picked up

132.name: Dive
132.description: Free kick or card event; player penalised for simulation

158.name: Persistent infringement
158.description: Card shown to player for persistent fouls

159.name: Foul and abusive language
159.description: Card shown for player using foul language

161.name: Encroachment
161.description: Card shown for player who moves within 10 yards of an opponent’s free kick

162.name: Leaving field
162.description: Card shown for player leaving the field without permission

163.name: Entering field
163.description: Card shown for player entering the field during play without referee's permission

165.name: Professional foul
165.description: Card shown for a deliberate tactical foul

166.name: Handling on the line
166.description: Card shown to an outfield player for using their hand to keep the ball out of the goal

171.name: Rescinded card
171.description: Referee rescind a card post match

172.name: No impact on timing
172.description: Player booked on bench but who hasn't played any minutes in the match

184.name: Dissent
184.description: Card shown when a player does not obey referee instructions

191.name: Off the ball foul
191.description: Foul committed by and on a player who is not in possession of the ball

192.name: Block by hand
192.description: Outfield player blocks a shot with their hand

244.name: Not Retreating
244.description: Card shown for player not retreating at a set-piece

245.name: Serious Foul
245.description: Card shown for player committing a serious foul

265.name: Attempted Tackle
265.description: Foul committed by an attempted tackle

289.name: Denied goal-scoring opp
289.description: Foul committed by a player denying a goal-scoring opportunity

291.name: Other Ball Contact Type
291.description: This is an automated extra event for DFL. It comes with a tackle or an interception and indicates if the player who made the tackle/interception retained the ball after this action or if the tackle/interception was a single ball touch (other ball contact with type “interception”, type “Defensive Clearance” or type “ TackleRetainedBall).

190.name: From shot off target
190.description: Used with Event 10. Indicates a shot was saved by the goalkeeper but in fact the shot was going wide and not on target

88.name: High claim
88.description: Event 11 Claim - Goalkeeper claims possession of a crossed ball

89.name: 1 on 1
89.description: When attacker was clear with no defenders between him and the goalkeeper (can be associated with 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15 or 16)

90.name: Deflected save
90.description: Event 10 Save; when goalkeeper saves a shot but does not catch the ball

91.name: Dive and deflect
91.description: Event 10 Save; when goalkeeper saves a shot while diving but does not catch the ball

92.name: Catch
92.description: Event 10 Save; when goalkeeper saves a shot and catches it

93.name: Dive and catch
93.description: Event 10 Save; when goalkeeper saves a shot while diving and catches it

123.name: Keeper Throw
123.description: Pass event - goalkeeper throws the ball out

128.name: Punch
128.description: Clearance by goalkeeper where he punches the ball clear

139.name: Own Player
139.description: Shot saved by goalkeeper that was deflected by a defender

173.name: Parried safe
173.description: Goalkeeper save where shot is parried to safety

174.name: Parried danger
174.description: Goalkeeper save where shot is parried but only to another opponent

177.name: Collected
177.description: Goalkeeper save and collects possession of the ball

181.name: Reaching
181.description: Goalkeeper save where goalkeeper reaches for the ball

182.name: Hands
182.description: Goalkeeper saves with his hands – REPLACED by 267-272

183.name: Feet
183.description: Goalkeeper save using his feet – REPLACED by 267-272

186.name: Scored
186.description: Goalkeeper event - shots faced and not saved resulting in goal

187.name: Saved
187.description: Goalkeeper event - shots faced and saved

188.name: Missed
188.description: Goalkeeper event - shot faced which went wide or over. Did not require a save.

198.name: GK hoof
198.description: Goalkeeper drops the ball on the ground and kicks it long towards a position rather than a specific player

199.name: Gk kick from hands
199.description: Goalkeeper kicks the ball forward straight out of his hands

287.name: Over-arm
287.description: Indicates over-arm throw out from keeper

232.name: Unchallenged
232.description: Goalkeeper smothers ball but is not under any challenge

14.name: Last line
14.description: When a player makes a defensive action and they are the last person between the opponent and the goal

94.name: Def block
94.description: Defender blocks an opposition shot. Shown with event 10.

167.name: Out of play
167.description: Tackle or clearance event sent the ball out of play

169.name: Leading to attempt
169.description: A player error, event 51, which leads to an opponent shot on goal

170.name: Leading to goal
170.description: A player error, event 51, which lead to an opponent scoring a goal

239.name: By Wall
239.description: Freekick situation blocked by wall – need associated outfielder hit

288.name: Out of Play Secs
288.description: Amount of time the ball was out of play in the last 5 minutes

30.name: Involved
30.description: This will show all players in the starting line up and available as a substitute

44.name: Player position
44.description: Goalkeeper, Defender, Midfielder, Forward or Substitute. These are the playing positions associated with each player for the specific match they are playing in.

59.name: Jersey number
59.description: This will be shown for substitutions, line ups, line up changes

131.name: Team player formation
131.description: Player position within a formation - See appendix 14

145.name: Formation slot
145.description: Formation position of a player coming on - see appendix 14

194.name: Captain
194.description: ID of the player who is the team captain

201.name: Referee delay
201.description: Delay in play instructed by referee

53.name: Injured player id
53.description: ID of the player who is injured and causing a delay in the game

202.name: Weather problem
202.description: Bad weather stops or interrupts play

203.name: Crowd trouble
203.description: Trouble within the crowd stops or delays play

204.name: Fire
204.description: Fire with the stadium stops or delays play

205.name: Object thrown on pitch
205.description: Object throw from the crowd lands on the pitch and delays play

206.name: Spectator on pitch
206.description: Spectator comes onto the pitch and forces a delay in play

207.name: Awaiting officials decision
207.description: Given to an event/delay where the referee still has to make a decision

226.name: Suspended
226.description: Game is has not finished but is suspended

227.name: Resume
227.description: Game has resumed after being suspended mid-way through on a previous date

246.name: Drinks Break
246.description: Game delayed due to drinks break

54.name: End cause
54.description: Golden goal, weather, crowd, insufficient players, floodlight failure, frozen pitch, waterlogged pitch, other, unknown

56.name: Zone
56.description: Area on the pitch - see appendix 13

127.name: Direction of play
127.vale: Right to Left or Left to Right
127.description: Event type 32 - Actual direction of play in relation to TV camera. X/Y coordinates however are ALWAYS all normalized to Left to Right.

144.name: Deleted event type
144.description: An event which should be removed. 'vale' will show the ID of this event

189.name: Player not visible
189.description: Broadcast footage showing replay and not live footage – this event is what Opta analysts believe occurred.

211.name: Overrun
211.description: TAKE ON (3) – where a player takes on an opponent but the ball runs away from them out of play or to an opponent.

229.name: Post-match complete
229.description: Opta post match quality control has been completed on this match

277.name: Minutes
277.description: Number of minutes of injury time given by the referee

45.name: Temperature
45.description: Very Cold, Cold, Pleasant, Warm, Hot – NO LONGER USED

47.name: Field Pitch
47.description: Water logged pitch, wet pitch, damp pitch, normal pitch, dry

48.name: Lightings
48.description: Flood lights, bad visibility, natural lights

258.name: Sold Out
258.description: Whether the game is sold out
